snippet: A 33-year-old woman’s family is battling a Fort Worth hospital because the medical staff refuses to follow their instructions (and the woman’s) to take her off life support, because she is pregnant.
abstract: Family of Marlise Munoz, 33-year-old brain-dead woman, is battling a Fort Worth hospital as medical staff, citing Texas law, refuses to follow her advance care directive and take her off life support because she is pregnant; case has become strange collision of law, medicine, ethics of end-of-life care and issues swirling around abortion, including when life begins and how it should be valued.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and ERIK ECKHOLM
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Fort Worth and Erik Eckholm from New York.

lead_paragraph: A 33-year-old woman’s family is battling a Fort Worth hospital because the medical staff refuses to follow their instructions (and the woman’s) to take her off life support, because she is pregnant.

headline.main: Pregnant, and Forced to Stay on Life Support
headline.print_headline: Pregnant, and Forced to Stay on Life Support

keywords.value: Living Wills and Health Care Proxies
keywords.name: subject
